People are always doing things they don't want to do, but if they're happy about it, then that means everyone is just faking happiness. They don't really care about you. My life has been ruined by those fake smiles. # Edit For clarification, the Overgeneralization distortion occurs when we make an assumption based on a limited number of instances. In this case, the distorted thinking reflects how she overestimates the extent to which others are untrustworthy because of one negative experience. When faced with multiple examples, she might realize that many people still value honesty and sincerity, and that her perception was overly broad. To address this, ask yourself questions like: * How would you feel if you were in her shoes? * What evidence do you have for your claim? * Would you generalize the same way if you experienced a positive interaction? These questions will help you evaluate whether your thoughts align with reality. If they do, you'll be able to adjust your perspective and avoid making assumptions based on incomplete information. By doing so, you'll become more open-minded and better equipped to handle complex situations in the future.
